org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.messages

Class Event.EventMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.messages.Event.EventMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Message
    Enclosing class:
    Event<TARGET_BLADE_TYPE extends Blade>

    private final class Event.EventMessage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Message
    The message subclass used to pass events. Event messages are not reused, with a new event message being created each time Event.signal is called.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) TARGET_BLADE_TYPE targetBlade
      The blade to be operated on.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Event.EventMessage(TARGET_BLADE_TYPE _targetBlade)
      Create an EventMessage.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close() 
      void eval()
      Execute the Event.processEvent or AsyncRequest.processAsyncRequest method of the event/request held by the message.
      boolean isForeign()
      Returns true when the response is to be sent to a targetReactor created with a different facility.
      boolean isIsolated()
      Returns true when the request is, directly or indirectly, from an IsolationReactor that awaits a response.
      boolean isResponsePending()
      Returns true when a response is expected but has not yet been placed in the message.
      void processException(Reactor _activeReactor, java.lang.Exception _e)
      Process the throwable on the current thread in the facility of the active targetReactor.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • eval

        public void eval()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Execute the Event.processEvent or AsyncRequest.processAsyncRequest method of the event/request held by the message. This method is always called on the target targetReactor's own thread.
        Specified by:
        eval in interface Message
